As a 32 year old, it's amazing to return to a game that my parents claimed was responsible for violence in youth.... and have so much frickin' fun! So much of this game is problem solving and puzzles, particularly because this game was still so early in 3D game design, that figuring out what to interact with, where to go, and what to do are not always very clear! lol. 17 hours in, and the game keeps giving. Can't wait to play HL2.

Even if you don't come back to this game, play it. Put it on the hardest difficulty, get some snacks and some friends, sit back and play this game and have an all nighter. A lot of newer games now a days don't give this same feeling of gaming that half life gives back then. If you want to play a REAL game that will whoop your ass over and over again that will give the a feeling of satisfaction when you beat it, play this game.

gog game

I played Half Life about 8 years ago and remember having a lot of fun. 8 years later it is as fun and then some. It's a fun adventure about Gordon Freeman told trough his eyes and the horrible events that took place at Black Mesa research facility. It has flaws that have not aged well. The movement is very loose and sensitive, it has some trial and error aspects that take you out of the experience a lot. As for horror it has it's moments but I would not consider it a horror game. The atmosphere is amazing and adds to the horror. My favorite part is the start area of the game because of the atmosphere. Overall I recommend at least one play trough of Half Life. You won't regret it because it's a classic and fun gaming experience.

Half-Life es un mundo totalmente extenso, en el cual yo creo que en este juego no se ha podido desarrollar tanto (perdida de potencial) pero esto se justifica debido a las capacidades de ese tiempo.
Dentro del juego damos muchas vueltas, conocemos muchos aliados/enemigos y a la vez conocemos su punto más flojo, el cual es la manera de contar la historia.

Esta se cuenta mediante encuentros con médicos, soldados, étc. Lo cual se hace medio pesado ya que si no escuchas bien no te enteras de que esta pasando a tu alrededor.

Consta de 18 capitulos de los cuales algunos podrían haber sido ahorrados, mas a mi parecer apartir del capitulo 9 es cuando el juego empieza a agilizarse y agarra mas potencia hasta el final.
Se me hizo largo, con dificultad intermedia me sacó unas 11 horas para poder terminarlo, hay situaciones donde debes usar la cabeza y en general los puzzles o mecanismos que requiere la solución del nivel son bastante divertidos.

La segunda mitad del juego explora mucho mejor el potencial de este y se me hizo lo mejor que presenta, las fisicas y graficos me parecen atractivos para un estilo de juego como este sin sobrepasarse debido a la época.
Conclusión, buen juego, divertido aunque puede tornarse monotono en ciertas ocasiones o estresarte.
La historia se fortalece llegando al final del juego y el final es incierto pero apropiado.

The graphics are a bit ugly, to be expected, its a gritty 1st person shooter from the 90's. It was that 90's charm for sure and the story holds up well enough to be play during any era. Should you get the remake Black Mesa? Honestly I'd say flip a coin and see which one you get because theres pros and cons for both.

This is without a doubt one of the best games of the 90s.
I am writing this a few minutes after beating the game.
Even if i didn't have loyalty to valve, i would consider this a masterpiece.
The AI are surprisingly smart, and the level design is great. The puzzles are challenging yet not frustratingly un-obvious like some other games i have played.
The beginning levels are a bit claustrophobic but the later levels open up.
The ending left me very satisfied.

9/10.
Still amazing, even today.

I recommend Half Life to someone who can over look its short comings within the story and gameplay. It has good gameplay, but the level design is dated. I can definitely see its appeal, and I enjoyed the majority of this game; I just got stuck many time sbecause of the "intricate" level design and "attention to detail." I had to resort to watching walkthroughs in order to progress in the story. I had little indication, other than NPCs, to give me some sort of meaning and goal in this game. Working with the NPCs, half of the time, resulted in me herding the AI like cattle to their proper position. I appreciated how the enemies had variety; this really added to the sense of feeling alone as Freeman. The ending is very underwhelming, considering that the devs had to rush the last few levels out. Overall, I would give this a 7/10 considering its influence, but also because of how dated some aspects are. Well worth 99 cents.

Boy did this not age well. Played through this when it came out, tortured myself through this for whatever reason in 2020. It's not worth it. This game is a tedious, obnoxious exercise in frustration. Play Doom, Quake, Heretic, Hexen, ROTT, anything other but this. Seriously: F. This. Game.
